title: All For Me Grog
lyrics:
[intro] | (D)     | (G)  (D) | (A)     | (D)     |
 
[chorus]
And it's (D)all for me grog, me (G)jolly, jolly (D)grog, all for me beer and to(A)bacco,
Well, I (D)spent all me tin with the (G)lassies drinkin' (D)gin,
Far across the western (A)ocean I must (D)wander.
 
I'm (D)sick in the head and I (G)haven't been to (D)bed
Since first I came ashore with me (A)plunder
I've seen (D)centipedes and snakes, me (G)head is full of (D)aches,
And I have to take a (A)path for way out (A7)yon(D)der.
 
[chorus]
And it's (D)all for me grog, me (G)jolly, jolly (D)grog, all for me beer and to(A)bacco,
Well, I (D)spent all me tin with the (G)lassies drinkin' (D)gin,
Far across the western (A)ocean I must (D)wander.
 
(D)Where are me boots, me (G)noggin' noggin' (D)boots,
They're all sold for beer and to(A)bacco.              
See, the (D)soles, they were thin and the (G)uppers were (D)lettin' in,
and the heels were looking (A)out for better (A7)wea(D)ther.
 
[chorus]
And it's (D)all for me grog, me (G)jolly, jolly (D)grog, all for me beer and to(A)bacco,
Well, I (D)spent all me tin with the (G)lassies drinkin' (D)gin,
Far across the western (A)ocean I must (D)wander.
 
(D)Where is me shirt, me (G)noggin' noggin' (D)shirt, it's all sold for beer and to(A)bacco.
The (D)sleeves they were worn out and the (G)collar being turned a(D)bout,
and the tail is looking (A)out for better (A7)wea(D)ther.
 
[chorus]
And it's (D)all for me grog, me (G)jolly, jolly (D)grog, all for me beer and to(A)bacco,
Well, I (D)spent all me tin with the (G)lassies drinkin' (D)gin,
Far across the western (A)ocean I must (D)wander.
 
(D)Where is me wife, me (G)noggin' noggin' (D)wife, she's all sold for beer and to(A)bacco.
You see, her (D)front was worn out and her (G)tail was kicked a(D)bout,
and I'm sure she's looking (A)out for better (A7)wea(D)ther.
 
[chorus]
And it's (D)all for me grog, me (G)jolly, jolly (D)grog, all for me beer and to(A)bacco,
Well, I (D)spent all me tin with the (G)lassies drinkin' (D)gin,
Far across the western (A)ocean I must (D)wander.
   
(D)Where is me bed, me (G)noggin' noggin' (D)bed, it's all sold for beer and to(A)bacco.
You see, I (D)sold it to the girls and so the (G)springs are all up(D)turned,
and the sheets are looking (A)out for better  (A7)wea(D)ther.
 
[chorus]
And it's (D)all for me grog, me (G)jolly, jolly (D)grog, all for me beer and to(A)bacco,
Well, I (D)spent all me tin with the (G)lassies drinkin' (D)gin,
Far across the western (A)ocean I must (A7)wan(D-single strum)der [end]
